snippet: Scientists have shown that DNA molecules can be the basis for a long-term storage system potentially capable of holding all of the world’s digital information in a tiny space.
abstract: Scientists demonstrate that synthetic DNA molecules can be foundation for archival storage system storing all of world's digital information in as little of nine liters of solution; new technology would be able to keep data stored safely for millennium or longer, and raw storage capacity of DNA is staggering compared with even the most advanced electronic or magnetic storage systems
lead_paragraph: Scientists have shown that DNA molecules can be the basis for a long-term storage system potentially capable of holding all of the world’s digital information in a tiny space.

headline.main: Data Storage on DNA Can Keep It Safe for Centuries
headline.print_headline: Synthetic DNA Is Seen as Way to Store Data for Centuries
